name: Vegetable-Filled Summer Rolls
author: Pascale Huntsinger
summary: These summer rolls make a light and nutritious meal, appetizer, or snack. They pairs well with Thai peanut sauce, plum sauce, or sweet chili sauce.
ingredients: ½ medium red bell pepper, sliced
½ medium green bell pepper, sliced
½ medium yellow bell pepper, sliced
directions: Bring a large pot of water to a boil
Remove from the heat and add rice noodles
Let soak for 8 to 10 minutes, until noodles are soft but firm, stirring occasionally
Fill a bowl with hot water (not boiling)
Submerge 1 sheet of rice paper into the water until soft, about 15 seconds
Place rice paper on a work surface and lay 1 piece of lettuce in the middle, starting at the bottom
Add some rice noodles, cabbage, sprouts, cilantro, carrot, avocado, and bell peppers
Pull up the bottom of the rice paper and roll up and over the vegetables
Fold in the sides of the sheet to seal
